Key Match Events: Dončić missed a turnaround fadeaway with under a minute to go and the Mavericks down 115-114
Steph Curry nailed a three-pointer with 27.5 seconds left to end the game
The Mavericks missed five of their last six shots and had one possession end in a turnover
Pre-Game Insights: Golden State coach Steve Kerr said he's tried guarding Luka Dončić one-on-one with mixed results
Coach Jason Kidd said the team needs to be better in crunch time
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Dončić said he’s still adjusting to playing off the ball more this season
Jason Kidd said the team got better despite losing, pointing to positive aspects like getting in the paint and having good looks that didn’t go down
Miscellaneous Highlights: Daniel Gafford and Dereck Lively II played together effectively as centers
Quentin Grimes had 29 effective minutes, six points, six rebounds, and no turnovers
Others: The Warriors have found a defensive-minded starting unit featuring Trayce Jackson-Davis, De’Anthony Melton, Draymond Green, Andrew Wiggins, and Curry
Buddy Hield is coming off the bench for the Warriors
